title: The One With The Giant Poking Device

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe, Chandler, and Ross are there, Rachel
is serving brownies.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Here you go Pheebs. Who else wants one of my special homemade brownies?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I will have one. (Ross and him both take one.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, I’m not gonna have one.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Neither will I. (they both put back the brownies.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, no, it’s just my tooth.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right I’ll have one. (he and Ross take another brownie,)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So what’s a matter, you need a dentist? I’ve got a good one.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No thanks, I have a good one too. I just, I, I can’t see him.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: See that is the problem with invisible dentists.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Why? Why can’t you go to him?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Because, every time I go to the dentist, somebody dies.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That is so weird, because every time I go to the dentist, I look down the hygienist’s blouse.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Phoebe, what? Umm...what?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah, first there was my aunt Mary, and then there was umm, John, my mailman, and then my, my cowboy friend ‘Albino Bob’.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And all these people actually died?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes, while I was in the chair! That’s why I take such good care of my teeth now, y'know, it’s not about oral hygiene, I floss to save lives!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Pheebs, come on, you didn’t kill anybody, these people just happened to die when you went to the dentist. It’s, it’s, it’s just ah, a coincidence.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well tell that to them. Oh! You can’t, their dead.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are there.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thanks, Gunther. (takes the plate Gunther serves him and Rachel comes up and kisses him) (to Rachel) Hey! (to Gunther) Umm, can I get a napkin too?

dialogue.speaker: GUNTHER
dialogue.text: Oh, like you don’t already have everything.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (trying to bite into an apple) Ow! Ow! (drops the apple in disgust.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Phoebe, your in pain, would you just go to the dentist, just go.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right, fine, fine, but if you’re my next victim, don’t come back as a poltergeist and like suck me into the TV set.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I promise.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Although, don’t feel like you can’t visit.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (entering with Monica) Hey, is, is, is Chandler here?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (patting his clothes like he is looking for his wallet) No, no he’s not.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You guys, Joey just saw Janice kissing her ex-husband.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What? (to Joey) So what are you going to do? I mean how, how are you going to tell Chandler?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, I was thinking about that and I, I think the best way would be, to not.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Joey, you can’t keep this to yourself, if you know about this, you have to tell him.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It’ll kill him. I mean it’ll, it’ll just kill him.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, you could wait ‘til I go to the dentist, maybe I’ll kill him.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, All are there except for Chandler.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (looking out the window) Ewww! Ugly Naked Guy is using his new hammock. It’s like a Play-Doo Fat Factory.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, I’m going to the dentist, so listen, okay, just be on the look out for anything that, that, that you can fall into, or, or that can fall on you, or... All right, just look out! Okay, And um, I also just wanna, I just wanna tell you all that um...... (starts to cry and runs out)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, I have a problem I have to go into work for a few hours, some kids messed up the Homo Sapien display.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What did they do?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, they painted over the word ‘Sapien’ for one thing, then they rearranged the figures, let’s just leave it at that.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So, do you want me to watch Ben for you?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes, that’s what I was going to ask, thank you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Whoa! Wait! Hello! What about me?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You? You! Want to watch Ben? (in the background Monica mouths ‘Don’t worry, I’ll be here the whole time.’ to Ross.) Yes! That’d be great, no, I just wanted to ask Monica, because I know how empty her life is. (Monica sarcastically mouths ‘Yeah!’ and holds up her thumb.)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey-hey, Ross?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I’ve got a science question.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hmm?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: If the Homo Sapiens, were in fact ‘Homo-sapien’, is that why there extinct?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Joey, Homo Sapiens are people.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey-hey, I’m not judging.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are babysitting Ben.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (holding Ben) Look Benny, spoon. (moves it back and forth) Spoon. Come on! All right, y'know what I think he’s bored.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Here. Ben, do you wanna play the airplane game, do you wanna show Rachel? Come here. (takes Ben) We’re gonna do something fun. Okay. (throws Ben up in the air a little bit and catches him) Weee!! (moves into the living room and does it again) Weee!! (starts to walk back into the kitchen as she does it again, and hits Ben’s head on that wooden beam across the ceiling.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Ben) Who’s so brave, you’re so brave, yes you are, you’re so brave.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay. Okay honey, he’s fine, he’s fine, let’s just put him down. Come here, Ben. (sets him on the couch) See that’s a good boy. (to Monica) How could you do that to him!! Ross trusted me, what is he going to say?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: He’s not gonna say anything, because we’re not gonna tell him.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: We’re not?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No we’re not.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right, I like that.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So we’re okay, we’re okay, we’re okay, (starts to exam Ben) aren’t we? No, we’re not okay, we’re not okay, there’s a bump, there’s a bump.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God! Well push it in! Push it in!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I cannot push it in!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, we’re gonna need a distraction.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I got it!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: The second that Ross walks in that door, I want you take him back to your bedroom and do whatever it is that you do that makes him go, (high pitched) rweee!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Or. We could put a hat on his head.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: A hat! Yes! We need a hat.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: We need a hat..

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Where are we gonna find a tiny little hat?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, oh, oh, I’ll get ‘Rainy Day Bear’!! (runs to get him)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Because he’ll know what to do? (Rachel comes out of her room with a bear that’s dressed in a rain suit.) Oh my God, you’re a genius!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh God, oh God, it’s sowed on though.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Give it. Give it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA AND RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, it’s just like a bloodbath in here today.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The street, Chandler and Joey are walking past a jewelery store.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey! Hold on a minute, hold on a second. Do you think these pearls are nice?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I’d really prefer a mountain bike.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Janice’s birthday is coming up, I want to get her something speacial. Come in here with me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, wait, whoa. Do you ah, want to get her something speacial, get her flowers, get her candy, get her gum, girls love gum.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That’s a good idea, ‘Dear Janice have a Hubba-Bubba birthday’. I would like to get her something serious.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, you want something serious. Y'know what you should do, you should get her one of those um, barium enemas. Those are dead serious.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right. Look, I’m gonna go in here, and you don’t buy me anything ever. (starts to go into the store)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (stopping him) No, no, you can’t, you can’t, okay, you can’t, you can’t buy her pearls, you just can’t, you can’t, you can’t.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Why not?!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh God. Uh, okay, here’s the thing, this is the thing, okay, the thing is...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What is the thing?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay. I went down to the ‘Mattress King’ showroom and, and I saw Janice, kissing her ex-husband.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (shocked) What?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: They were in his office.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well she, she wouldn’t do that, she’s with, she’s with me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I’m telling you man, I saw it.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, you’re wrong! Okay, you’re wrong.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I’m not wrong! I wish I was. I’m sorry. Bet that barium enema doesn’t sound so bad now, huh?

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are dressing up Ben in the entire rain
suit from Rainy Day Bear.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It just makes more sense as an ensemble.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Besides, it takes the focus off the hat.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (running through the door) No! Oh! You’re alive! You’re alive!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: See Pheebs, I promised you no one would die, didn’t I?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, we’ll see about that. Can I use your phone? I just wanna call everyone I know.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Sure, we have no money, go ahead.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (on phone) ‘Hey! You’re not dead! Okay, see ya!’

dialogue.speaker: BEN
dialogue.text: Monica.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God! He just said my name! Did you hear that?

dialogue.speaker: BEN
dialogue.text: Monica bang!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, I heard that.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Did he just say ‘Monica bang’?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh-huh.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God! He’s gonna rat me out!

dialogue.speaker: BEN
dialogue.text: Monica bang!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh-ho-ho, sweetie, sweetie, you gotta stop saying that, now. It’s no big deal, it’s not even worth mentioning, you see we all do it all the time. See watch this, Ben, Ben, Ben. (goes over and starts hitting her head on the post) Ow, Monica bang! (does it again) Everybody bang. (repeats) Ben bang. (repeats) Rachel bang. (repeats) Bang, Rachel bang! Oh, isn’t that fun?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (goes over and hits her head on the post) Look at that! (repeats) Look at that! (repeats) We all do it. (repeats) Okay, I’m stopping now.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You okay?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh yeah! Y'know, if it’s not a headboard, it’s just not worth it.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is waiting for Janice to arrive, and is angrily
fllipping through a magazine.]

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: (entering) How’s my Bing-a-ling?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ah, I don’t know, you tell me. Anything you ah, wanna tell me, because, if you ah, you should, if you, you would, tell me.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Why are your eyes so white?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You tell me! Maybe, it’s because I was just fooling with my ex! Oh no-no-no-no, no-no-no-no, that was you!!

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Oh my God!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right!

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: How did you know?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Joey told me, he saw you two kissing.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: In the park?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No! In his office! How many kisses were there?

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Just those two!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Wh-wh-why, wh-why, why, why was there kissing!? There should be no kissing!!

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Oh, I’m sorry honey, I’m so, so, (nasally) haaaaa! I’m so, so sorry, I just (nasally) haaaaaa! But I, oh what happened was, I-I-I can’t breathe. Can you get me a bag, or something?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (giving her a bag) Here.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: The receipt.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I’ll take it! All right look, I gotta know. Are you finished with me? (Janice shakes her head no) Are you finished with him? (Janice shakes her head no) Do you still love him? (Janice shakes her head yes) Do you still love me? (Janice shakes her head yes) All right look, (grabs the bag) I’m gonna need an actual answer here okay, so which is it, him or me? (his phone starts to ring)

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: I don’t know.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (rushing in) Okay. If you’re alive you answer your phone!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Rachel, Phoebe, and Joey are there.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, Ben, I won’t tell your daddy that you had ice cream for dinner, if you don’t tell about our little bonking incident.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Monica, number one, I don’t think Ben understands the concept of bribery, and number two, I... (Joey starts laughing in the background) (to Joey) What?!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You said number two.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I also said number one.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I know. (giggles harder)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey! Everyone.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: How’s my little boy?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: He’s perfect, he’s never been better.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (noticing the outfit he is wearing) What’d you do, take him whaling?

dialogue.speaker: BEN
dialogue.text: Monica.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh my God, he just said your name, that’s great! Good job Ben.

dialogue.speaker: BEN
dialogue.text: Monica bang!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh that’s right, that’s what I’d sound like if I exploded.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Woo-Hoo! The curse is broken! I called everybody I know, and everyone is alive.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ugly Naked Guy looks awfully still. (Phoebe runs to the window and gasps.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh my God! I killed him! I killed another one! And this curse is getting stronger too, to bring down something that big.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well maybe he’s just taking a nap.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I’m tellin’ ya, he hasn’t moved since this morning.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right, we should call somebody.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: And tell them what? The naked guy we stare at all the time isn’t moving.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, we have gotta find out if he’s alive.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How are we gonna do that? There’s no way.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, there is one way. His window’s open, I say, we poke him.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is throwing darts, as Joey enters.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey! Y'know how we ah, save all those chopsticks for no reason we get when we get Chinese food?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, now we got a reason.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, we’re fashioning a very long poking device.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey uh, what’s a matter?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I talked to Janice.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh my God, is she going back to him?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: She doesn’t know. Says she loves us both. Y'know I woke up this morning and I was in love, well I was happy. Y'know it serves me right for buying that twelve pack of condoms. And now I can’t even return them, because she choked on the reciept!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What are you ah, what are you gonna do?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I don’t know, y'know. What, what, would you do?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, it doesn’t matter what I would do.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Come on, tell me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, you’re probably not gonna want to hear this but ah, if it was me, and this is just me, (Chandler gets ready to throw another dart) I would ah, I would bow out.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What? (turns around quickly still ready to throw the dart and Joey quickly ducks and hides behind the chair) What are you, what are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: They have a kid together, y'know. They’re like, they’re like a family, and if, I don’t know, there’s chance they could make that work, I know I wouldn’t want to be the guy who stood in the way of that. Are you okay? Do you wanna ah, come poke a nude guy?

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross has just finished putting Ben to sleep, and is
entering from Rachel’s room.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, he’s finally alseep. About that ah, bump on his head?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Are you, are you, are you sure it’s ah, a new bump? I mean, no offense, I’ve always thought of Ben as a fairly bumpy headed child.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It’s okay if he bumps his head, kids bump their heads all the time, y'know, it was your first time babysitting, I figured you did the best you could.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (confidently) I did!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I know! I’m saying you have to watch them all the time.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I did!! I watched! I watched! I watched Monica bang his head against that thing!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Monica did it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Monica?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Umm, did you notice anything wierd about Ben today?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No. Why?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, I was just playing with him, and y'know we were doing the alphabet song, which he used to be really good at, but suddenly he’s leaving out ‘e’ and ‘f.’ It’s like they just ah, I don’t know, fell out of his head.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Really?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, and also, he’s, he’s walkin’ kind of funny, his left leg is moving a lot faster than his right leg, and he’s in there just sort of y'know... (walks around in a circle)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God, I wrecked your baby!! (runs into the bedroom)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I hope it’s still funny when you’re in hell.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (coming out of the bedroom) You jerk! You know how much I love that kid! (starts to chase Ross around the living room)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Monica bang! Monica bang! (runs into one of the posts) Ow!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I’ll get the hat.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler and Janice are there.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Janice, I have something I need to tell you, and I want you to let me get through it, because it’s, it’s, it’s not gonna be easy.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I think you should go back with Gary. I don’t wanna be the guy that breaks up a family, y'know when my parents split up, it was because of that guy. Whenever I would see him I was always think y'know ‘You’re the reason, you are the reason why their not together.’ and I hated that guy. And it didn’t matter how nice he was, or how happy he made my Dad.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Wow!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, well. It’s the right thing to do.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Oh! You’re right. Oh God. But, before I can say ‘good-bye’, there’s something I really need you to know, Chandler. The way I feel about you, it’s like, I finally understand what Lionel Richie’s been singing about. Y'know, I mean what we have, it’s like movie love, you’re my soulmate, and I can’t believe we’re not going to be spending the rest of our lives together.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Then don’t leave me!

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Forget what I said, I was babbling! Pick me!

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: No, you were right, you were right. I mean, I-I-I’ve got to give my marriage another chance.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No you don’t! No, no, no, I say you have to give your divorce another chance.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: (standing up) I’m sorry. (hugs him)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ohhh. Don’t go.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: No, I-I-I gotta go. (she starts to walk away, but Chandler doesn’t let her go.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No. No! No! No!

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Honey, honey, people are looking.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I don’t care! (turns around and to the people watching them) I don’t care!!

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Yeah, um, I’m, I’m leaving now. (tries to get her leg out of Chandler’s grasp, she finally does, but Chandler takes off her shoe.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You can’t leave! I have your shoe!

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Good-bye Chandler Bing. (walks out with one shoe)

dialogue.speaker: GUNTHER
dialogue.text: Rachel has those in burgendy.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey, Rachel, Monica, Phoebe, and Ross are holding the
giant poking device.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right now remember, something this big and long is going to be difficult to manuver, fortunately I have a lot of experience in that area.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Can we please focus here, a naked man’s life hangs in the balance!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I’m telling you he’s dead. What we are about to have here is a dead fat guy on a stick.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, ladies and gentlemen, let’s poke. (they start to advance the giant poking device) Steady. Steady. Okay, a little higher. Careful of the angle. Okay, okay, we’re approaching the window (as he says this the camera cuts to their view of Ugly Naked Guy, so that we actually see him!) Thread the needle. Thread the needle.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: He’s alive! He’s a-live!!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: And yet, we’re still poking him.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay, retract the device, retract the device.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: He does not look happy.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey-hey, now he’s showing us his poking device.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, that’s never gonna make it all the way over here, buddy!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is listening to a Lionel Richie album]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (singing) I’ll hold you close in my arms . (Phoebe enters) I can’t resist your charms. And love....

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (joining him) Love....

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER AND PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I’ll be a fool for you. I’m sure, you know I don’t mind .

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (high pitched) No you know I don’t mind .

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER AND PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes! You mean the world the world to me. Oh...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I know .

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I know .

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I’ve found .

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I’ve found....

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER AND PHOEBE
dialogue.text: ...in you, my endless (Phoebe goes high pitched, Chandler goes low pitched) love . (they both look at each other.) My endless love . (once again they don’t match tones, and they just look at each other)
